legal_citations: Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992

sections.heading: 1. ENTITLEMENT
sections.text:
1.1 All employees are entitled to 52 weeks' maternity leave regardless of length of service:
- Ordinary Maternity Leave (OML): 26 weeks
- Additional Maternity Leave (AML): 26 weeks

1.2 You can start maternity leave any time from 11 weeks before your expected week of childbirth (EWC).

sections.heading: 2. NOTIFICATION
sections.text:
2.1 By the end of the 15th week before EWC (or as soon as reasonably practicable), notify your manager in writing of:
- Your pregnancy
- Your EWC (provide MATB1 certificate)
- Your intended start date for maternity leave

2.2 We will write to you within 28 days confirming your expected return date.

sections.heading: 3. STATUTORY MATERNITY PAY (SMP)
sections.text:
3.1 Eligibility: Employed for at least 26 weeks by the 15th week before EWC and earning above LEL (£123/week in 2025).

3.2 SMP is paid for 39 weeks:
- Weeks 1-6: 90% of average weekly earnings
- Weeks 7-39: £184.03/week or 90% of earnings (whichever is lower) [2025 rate]

3.3 [OPTIONAL: Enhanced maternity pay - [DETAILS]]

sections.heading: 4. RIGHTS DURING LEAVE
sections.text:
4.1 During OML (first 26 weeks), all contractual terms continue except pay.

4.2 During AML (weeks 27-52), you are entitled to benefit from implied terms of trust and confidence and any terms relating to notice, redundancy compensation, and disciplinary/grievance procedures.

4.3 Holiday continues to accrue during the full 52 weeks.

4.4 Pension contributions: [DETAILS]

sections.heading: 5. KEEPING IN TOUCH (KIT) DAYS
sections.text:
5.1 You may work up to 10 KIT days during maternity leave without losing SMP or ending your leave.

5.2 KIT days are optional and must be agreed in advance.

5.3 You will be paid [KIT_PAY_RATE] for KIT days.

sections.heading: 6. RETURN TO WORK
sections.text:
6.1 If returning after OML, you are entitled to return to the same job.

6.2 If returning after AML, you are entitled to return to the same job or, if not reasonably practicable, a suitable alternative on no less favourable terms.

6.3 To return early, give 8 weeks' notice.

6.4 If you do not return, you are deemed to have resigned from your return date.

compliance_checklist: Holiday accrual during full leave confirmed
